Reviews.AuthorLocation: La Fortuna de San Carlos, Costa Rica
Reviews.Title: “New paint and clean grounds don't make a good stay.”
Reviews.Author: Firerock17
Reviews.Content: Not impressed with parking, staff,service, clientel or locals and immediate area. Beds and rooms ok...no hot water and had to ask for towels and waited...There is a Sprouts,Starbucks, Target and Walgreens. We will not stay here again. Just never got that comfortable feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Only Airport shuttle TO airport, not FROM”
Reviews.Author: bob j
Reviews.Content: "Airport shuttle" is a lie. Only to the airport and only at inconvenient times. Smells like smoke in a nonsmoking room. Bed uncomfortable. TV reception fuzzy.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Stay and bargin”
Reviews.Author: Lesley C
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed there for one night prior to taking a cruise. Was a little leary at first as had read some bad reviews - but it fell into the price range and convenience I was looking for and was close to the parking facility I would be using for the cruise. The property is well kept - has two different sections of rooms - had lots of parking. Staff at the desk and on the property was very nice and friendly. A continental breakfast was included in the room price - AND you could upgrade to a full HOT breakfast for just $5 - which we did and it was a hot and hardy breakfast with pancakes and eggs in addition to everything already available. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Beds were medium hard - good pillows. the room had a refridgerator and microwave - was near the pool and hot tub which was being used even though it was February - so I assume it must have been heated. The Inn was near many places to eat within walking distance - and even more restaurants and fast food within 1/2 mile. I would definitely stay there again if in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Check the shuttle hours first.”
Reviews.Author: Rufusrustbucket
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine, just used it as a place to sleep before catching a flight. Problem is that the airport shuttle doesn't run early in the morning and I had to take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money, would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: theg00dnamesrtaken
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! For the amenities, service and comfort I would have expected to pay quite a bit more. Breakfast was amazing--though by definition a continental breakfast is just coffee and roll or pastries this hotel had a full hot breakfast with made-to-order pancakes and eggs plus oatmeal, a variety of (not old!) pastries, bread and bagels (with toasters right there, plus cream cheese and butter), coffee, orange juice, apple juice, and apples/oranges. We actually left quite full each day and for free. The staff was very nice and helpful and went out of their way. The pool area (which had a hot tub) was clean; the pool was heated so even though it was cool during my stay I still swam. The hotel was near many excellent restaurants (loved Georgia's Greek Cuisine and Taste of the Himalayas Indian food) and stores, plus several buses are nearby and it's close to the Old Town transit center. The rooms were clean (no unpleasant odor, something I fear from former smoking hotels!), the bed was comfortable with a nice thick comforter. The room had a fridge, microwave, tub/shower, wifi, a/c unit, hot water machine and instant coffee. We used the free hotel shuttle on February 28th, it was very handy, took us to the airport for free and the shuttle had a 5mile radius which would cover downtown, the zoo (Balboa Park), and Seaworld. I didn't see that mentioned on their website or I would have used it to get an airport pickup. I will definitely stay here next time I visit! For the price I paid I expected much less. The only thing I could think to complain about was that the outside walls were thin and it was quite audible when people were loud outside but we were in a corner room right near stairs which made it more heavily trafficked. (Oh, and I agree that the coffee wasn't great.) Some people complained about a lack of hot water but I used a lot and had no problems.)

Reviews.Title: “"We wished we could have gone somewhere else."”
Reviews.Author: Sheri B
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel with a free airport shuttle this is not the one! They advertised it with free shuttle services but this is incorrect during February. We were not told this until after we arrived, sure would have been nice for them to have it on the web page ad that the shuttle is only available certain times of the year. If we had known this we would have pick another hotel. There continental breakfast stinks it was tasteless & served in one room & you had to go outside & across to another cold room to eat it. The coffee in the room was very bitter. The room was clean but I still wouldn't recommend this hotel. If it wasn't for the money issue we would have went somewhere else for sure!

Reviews.Title: “From one MCRD familes to another, we do not recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Eileen T
Reviews.Content: This is not a good hotel, period! Lacks; hot water; proper linens; clear rooms, appreciative and accommodating front desk staff and management. Breakfast is just okay, coffee not good. Some of the staff were kind and pleasant, however they lacked proper training and accurate information. Our reservations were made 2 months in advance and we called 3 different times to confirm their amenities, shuttle service and other accommodations; all of which were not either non-existent or misrepresented over the phone. We did not care for the shuttle service to and from the MCRD. The times were limited and the wait was long. The shuttle does not drop you off at the gate, but rather goes through the gate, the inspection and will drop off riders at different locations around the base. While this is a nice service, it makes for a lengthy wait for the riders in lines at the other end, and they hotel only runs 2 shuttles to and from MCRD. MCRD graduation is a very special time for a Marine's family and friends, you should have a clean, comfortable and friendly place to enjoy your trip for such a special celebration.

Reviews.Title: “noisy”
Reviews.Author: patadperro
Reviews.Content: This is a low budget well located hotel, its access to the main freeways are only a couple of blocks away, there is a target store at 2 blocks walking distance, an Ihop jut 3 blocks away and accross the street a Starbucks. Inside the room you have the basics for a family trip such as microwave, fridge, and a small table. The area to improve is that the hotel is to noisy and you can hear the people below and besides your room. the breakfast that is included is poor, as there is only 2 cereals, apples, sometimes oranges and only 2 tosters for the whole area, for $5 usd you can obtain a plate with scrambled eggs and pancakes that looked ok. all the phone calls have a cost, and even at the reception if you request the phone for a quick local call it will be denied. Next trip to San Diego I will pay a little more to obtain a quiet sleep and a better breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Bad in every respect”
Reviews.Author: WeOwnAFatCat
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego for the USMC graduation and were charged an extra $100 a night because we made our reservation through the wrong website! The less than friendly manager would not give us the same rate as even the members of our own family who were there for the same reason- talk about working with the customer. However she did give us a 20% discount only ripping us off for about 70 bucks more than other guests. The rooms are across the street in a building surrounded by a parking lot that is almost too narrow to park your car. We had no coffee maker in our room and, when I called the front desk, they sent up a "hot water" maker with parts missing from it. The bottom of the exterior door had a gap so wide, a full grown doberman might have been able to crawl under it. There is a free breakfast which either consists of pastries (one full plastic bag of bagels was molded and rotten) or you could have eggs and pancakes IF you had the right colored ticket. Apparently, you get the tickets based on how you reserve your room. This place is horrible; RUN to another hotel if in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced place for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Sarah K
Reviews.Content: - Hotel was very clean, including the pool area - Staff was courteous and helpful - Shuttle was easy to sign up for and use. It was a bit late one day for zoo pickup so be sure not to rely on it if you're on a tight sight-seeing schedule as I believe priority is given to airport trips - I disliked that smoking was allowed in the pool area - I thought it would be nice if there were recycling boxes in the room for bottles and paper. We ended up carrying our recycling around with us until we found other public bins. - When we reserved, we were told there would be a free continental breakfast. This was cancelled half way through our stay but we were given vouchers for a limited selection in the onsite restaurant. - The restaurant food was good but the service was very inconsistent. The waitresses were fine but sometimes the food took an extraordinarily long time to come, even if the restaurant did not appear busy. This resulted in us having to cancel our order one morning so we could make the shuttle, and we had to buy food elsewhere, which was annoying and expensive. - A/C unit was rather noisy - Our room was near the front of the hotel but the freeway noise didn't bother us. - Overall, it was a good place for our family vacation. I was there with my 13 year old niece. - There was a family movie night by the pool on Friday and Saturday. - The public computer in the lobby went out of service on our second last day there and we were unable to use it to check in for our flight, as it was still out of service when we left the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Never a good experience with Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: adinarj
Reviews.Content: The hotel was supposed to be non-smoking. The first room we were put in had been recently taken out of "retirement." It was smoky and musty and gave me a headache from the first moment I stepped in. Plus, it was right at the front so you could hear everyone partying and would have heard everyone coming in drunk at 3AM. The staff was very nice and very helpful; they set us up with a new room that was better. Still musty, but not as bad. The towels were thin and rough and the beds were hard. The continental breakfast was just okay. The wireless was good and appreciated. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: sunsetd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before, however, in our first night we learned what a difference two years can make. There was a night club now close by and their music (well if you can call it music) kept us awake all night together with the panic alarm of a car. Unfortunately, the owner was not interested in stopping it. So was the hotel staff who heard it but decided to do nothing about it at 3pm in the morning. The suite we had was ok, clean and everything worked fine. Complimentary breakfast was also available but the motel is very crowded especially during breakfast hours. If you want to enjoy your breakfast peacefully you should do so on your room.

Reviews.Title: “If you stay at this hotel you will need a vehicle”
Reviews.Author: BUSTERBROWN11
Reviews.Content: Last summer my daughter and I stayed at this hotel. It was okay, rooms were reasonably clean but no complimentary breakfast although there is a restaurant on site which was a little steep in price for what you get. There is a small fridge, safe, and microwave. It isn't fancy, the decor is tired and all the corridors are outside so you might as well say it's a motel. The staff are fairly friendly. There is a computer in the front lobby that you can use to print your boarding passes and check e mails on a first come first serve basis. To get around you really need to have a vehicle which we didn't and regretted it. There isn't anything around for quite a few miles except hotels, free ways and homeless people sleeping under the underpasses and near the property. There is a security guard at night doing rounds on the property. There is a shuttle at the hotel that will take you to the zoo and sea world daily at different times during the day, just make sure to register the day before. The shuttle was good and there isn't a cost but they strongly encourage tips. The pool is at the very back of the property and was private and clean, but not overly big. The Trolley Tours does stop just past the hotel which you can get and off at your leisure from the morning until evening for adults $34.00 & $17.00 cash only if paying the conductor or cheaper to buy online. The trolley will take you all over San Diego and Coronado Island. I only wish we had more time because if want to see all the sites you really need a minimum of 2 days. The tours were fantastic and informative. The bottom line is if we were to go back to San Diego, we will find another hotel closer into the city and will definitely rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: MichiganHappyone
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights. The first two nights our air conditioner did not work. I called the front desk on 3 seperate occasions about this issue. A maintenace man was sent up twice, and the third time 2 maintenance men came to our room to work on it. I finally requested to switch rooms, which they didn't want to do. I had to be aggressive with my displeasure with not having an air conditioner to get another room. One of the positives was the breakfast. It was really good. They also had a nice pool, but we didn't get to use it. Overall was a decent hotel. We received one free night for our inconveniece.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected and more.”
Reviews.Author: Chrisbry
Reviews.Content: The staff is extremely helpful; beds were comfortable (except for the fold out but I'm not sure one of those exist in the world!) Room was quiet and clean. We did buy an air freshner but we do that in most hotels we stay in. We asked for extra towels and got them right away. Breakfast was everything and more -- hot, delicious, and the shuttles were on time! We used them to go to the MCRD for Family Day & Graduation. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: gregsf11
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical at first given some of the other reviews, but it turned out to meet and even exceed expectations. The room was clean, the bed comfortable. I liked the fact that there was a computer with internet available in the lobby for guests free of charge. Rooms also come equipped with fridge and microwave. Some might call the neighborhood "sketchy," but I've lived in San Diego before and I'd never consider the neighborhood dangerous. Yes, a car comes in handy here. But it is technically possible to walk a half a mile to the Old Town transport hub where the trolley and numerous buses stop. I had a car on this trip, but a half mile really isn't bad. It's not directly in downtown; but consider the flipside -if it were downtown, then you'd have no place to park your car, or you pay through the nose for the priveledge. I was a little disappointed with breakfast on the first morning. Pretty minimal. But that's before I discovered a whole second room where they cook you eggs and pancakes. Real eggs too, not the powered stuff. Plus cereal, juice, fruit, bread, and a few not-too-appetizing pastries. But hey, it works. Among all that there's bound to be something edible. Overall nothing memorable, but it was a last minute booking and it turned out better than expected. Seriously, what would you get in an expensive hotel that you don't get here?

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Lonnette B
Reviews.Content: I took a trip to San Diego Ca for my sons graduation from Marine Corp Boot Camp. The staff was very helpful and took us wherever we wanted to go. The place was clean, the food was plentiful. I would recommend this place for the person looking for something close to MCRD, Sea World and the Airport. There were plenty of restaurants close by. I would definetly stay there again if I had the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Budget accomodation”
Reviews.Author: travellintitch
Reviews.Content: I was travelling as part of a tour group for 18-35's. This is a budget accomodation that was clean and comfortable. The rooms had effective air conditioning, a large fridge, coffee making facilities and a small outdoor swimming pool. It was nice to have to have the option of a dip after a busy day exploring! There were food shops within walking distance and a garage nearby. Beds were remade daily and the linen was changed. It was no luxury but perfectly fine as a base for exploring just for a few days. Personally, I was disappointed in breakfast. The toasters didn't work and the fruit was more than ripe. If I were to visit again I would sort out my own breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Should be called the "Dive Inn"”
Reviews.Author: Munchdog
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter and I booked this hotel as it was close to Seaworld. In all my travels I have never stayed in such a dive! I put a chair against the door, as I was afraid for our safety. I cannot believe they recommend this as one of the places to stay by Seaworld. We moved across the way to the Comfort Inn and it was a hundred times better for the same cost!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but for the construction”
Reviews.Author: KWKSUBS
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the final few days of our trip, looking for something roomy enough for 4, affordable, and with parking and breakfast. The king suite room was a bit type for 4, but certainly acceptable; The price was definitely right; The breakfast was nothing to write home about, but plentiful and acceptable; And the parking is incredibly tight, but there were enough spots that you didn't need to struggle to fit into some wacky space. Unfortunately there was construction right next door, that woke us up at abt 7:30 am. But we asked to have our room changed and that made it much more bearable. Two more plusses; The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. And the pool was nice; and generally uncrowded.

Reviews.Title: “It's all in the details...”
Reviews.Author: tysonsworld
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with the fact I was paying a budget price,I did do my research and knew it had mixed reviews but more positive than negative. So, with that knowledge in mind, I was prepared for basic, no frills. Loved the proximity to Seaworld and Mission Bay, the Zoo etc - my main priority. Free parking and internet also a plus. Free breakfast...interesting arrangement in a separate building across the street - kind of a free for all with broken toasters, tired looking fruit and basic bagels...but hey it was included in the price. What isn't is the hot breakfast - yours for additional $5 per person. Kinda missed that in the booking process...hmmm. The room though tidy and with newish bathroom and sink fittings, had a carpet I didn't dare walk on barefoot. Enough said. Details which were just annoying and unnecessary: Two shampoos and no conditioner. Missing drawer in the coffee machine for the coffee filter pouch. When I called front desk, they seemed to have prescience on the subject and answered me before I got the word coffee out of my mouth. Apparently this was 'a new thing they're trying'. What? To bamboozle the guest for a simple cup of coffee? Why? I guess if I'd opened the coffee first and saw it was a bag like a tea bag instead of a pouch I'd have worked out that the machine was being 'McGyvered' to fit bags instead of pouches...of course!. Bizarre. So lesson learnt - overall I got what I paid for and little extra for my trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Not great at all!”
Reviews.Author: Shearer4
Reviews.Content: Dingy hotel next to an empty lot where homeless people gathered (very sad). Not only were the rooms not clean, but nothing worked; the coffee maker was broken and the a/c was soooo loud. Customer service was non existant. They offered free breakfast, but if you did not purchase the breakfast upgrade for $5/person, you got broken toasters and never enough cereal. They offered free shuttle to Sea World, which we took advanatge of, but we regreted not taking our rental car since it ended up being free parking at SW, and the shuttle did not come to pick us up when they said they would. So it costs us more to take a cab back. Sorry to say, we would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck-yuck-yuck”
Reviews.Author: Laurie L
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel over other same priced area hotels because the other reviews said the breakfast was great. But, when we got there, the front desk told me that since I had booked through a 3rd party like priceline, we would have to pay an additional $5 per person if we wanted any of the "warm" food like eggs or pancakes. On the second day, I decided to pony up and buy the warm food, at which point, the front desk said it was free and asked me who had told me I had to pay in the first place...and it was the same person who had told me! Also- our air conditioner made jet airline noises in the middle of the night and shot pieces of plastic into the room each night. Maintenance told me it was fine and didn't need to be fixed. The location is near many things, but it felt a bit questionable. The building corridors and design are dark and creepy. The room was fine, but we certainly dreaded coming back to the hotel for 3 nights. The only reason we stayed all 3 nights was because we had prepaid through a 3rd party and didn't think we could get our money back. This is the first time I have ever felt the need to write a review for any hotel...stay away from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “They made my trip fun, easy and affordable!”
Reviews.Author: khidalgo
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly! They had a shuttle service that was able to take us to the hottest spots in San Diego and the drivers were very friendly and fun to talk to and made sure our trip was the best it could be :) At night we could see fireworks from our room! How could you go wrong? Everything you need is close by, there's a plaza directly across the street with a whole bunch of shops like TJ Maxx. The hotel is located at a great location thats equal distance (around 10 mins) to anywhere you wanna go like Seaworld, Mission Beach etc. The continental breakfast is not bad, they also have a hot breakfast that serves pancakes and what not. Overall the hotel was a great value! We weren't looking for a 5 star hotel or anything, just a place to chill and lay our heads and here we got more than we asked for, almost felt like home! The only good part about leaving was so I didn't get too comfortable haha My friend and I came to San Diego looking for a good time and we definately found it the trip was great, miss it already can you tell?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: thegardencottage
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 6 days while visiting our daughter. It was close to everything...We had a King suite and it was lovely! Everything was clean and well kept. The daily breakfast was amazing! We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Time to re-think your rules and regulations. You fail!”
Reviews.Author: feldy7649
Reviews.Content: I would have to say the management does not know how to run the pool. You don't let 20 kids under the age of 14 take over the hot tub then tell the adults they have leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool, Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Leeny1221
Reviews.Content: So okay. This is not in a fancy resort area of San Diego, and yes, there are strip clubs around. But I promise you we did not see a single stripper hanging around the hotel. What we had was a comfortable, two-room, two-TV, suite overlooking the pool and hot tub, for under $100 a night, where our two grandchildren could each have his/her own TV (no fighting over what to watch). his/her own comfortable bed, a nice, warm swimming pool, and a good, hot breakfast. I've never been at a Days Inn that served fresh eggs, hash browns and pancakes in the morning. We ate outdoors by the pool one morning, which was lovely, and they had a comfortable indoor dining area, which was quite large and offered cold cereal, juice and coffee. The staff could not be more gracious and helpful. We were close to the zoo and Sea World, and a nice drive to the Safari Park. If you're looking for a nice, reasonably priced hotel in San Diego, close to many fast food restaurants and malls, I would feel very comfortable recommending this hotel. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place. Best for sea world & san diego zoo”
Reviews.Author: piduman
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here for a couple of days when we went to see Sea World and San Diego zoo. This place is very conveniently close to both the places and was very affordable. Since we went in the middle of the week, we had a deal where we paid around 70$ for each night. We did not like the complimentary breakfast offered - we just ate outside but we were fine with that because of the location. Parking was a little crowded (we could not find parking near our room but again, it was not a big deal)

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay EVER-seriously!”
Reviews.Author: avacation839
Reviews.Content: If you book here, you will regret it! My family and I were supposed to have a somewhat extended stay here and after 1 night, I simply couldn't do it. I did not sleep. This is honestly the worst stay I have ever experienced in a hotel and I don't ask for much-just a safe, clean, quiet, cool place to sleep. This hotel was none of those things. Our room had a sliding door that leads directly to the parking lot-the only thing that keeps you separate is a flimsy bar-not very reassuring. There was a large group outside of our door arguing for a long time early in the evening. Then, my husband and I noticed the room wasn't cooling even after about 2 hours. We called the front desk and they sent a maintenance man (who arrived very quickly by the way-only positive thing I can say about the stay) who overrode the system so that you could set the temperature all the way down to 48 degrees. Guess what, still didn't work! He said if it didn't work after 15 minutes, tell them the following day to switch rooms for the remainder of the stay, though he did warn us that the 3rd floor is very noisy because that's where the air-conditioning generators are located. As if the heat wasn't enough, the noise from above was AWFUL!!! It sounded like the ceiling was going to cave in. Called the front desk and they said they would send someone to check it out. Didn't stop until about 4 am. At that point I went into the front area and killed 2 ROACHES on the cabinets!!! Called front desk and they blamed it on the greenery. Oh, I'm sure it has nothing to do with the huge gap between the door and the floor. Disgusting! Also, while it is close to Seaworld, the other hotel that we ended up switching to in the hotel circle was just as close, and didn't have adult shops, strip clubs, and women of the night everywhere-and it was cheaper before the satisfaction discount was applied! Bottom line-don't do this to yourself. Because of the horrific experience they discounted my stay 50%, leaving me at $65 for a sleepless night, but because I was so exhausted, I was in no mood to argue. I paid $80/night at a wonderful hotel in the hotel circle and could not have been happier to get away from this seedy motel-and I stayed in one of the Suites!!! I could only imagine what the poor guests in the regular portion of the motel experienced. If after reading this you stay here, you will have gotten what you deserve!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again!”
Reviews.Author: MOMMY2BEE
Reviews.Content: We had a horrible experience. We got our hotel room on the first floor which was great since I am 6 mo pregnant. We dropped off our luggage and headed to the beach. When we got back there was water gushing out from under the door. Maintenace turned on their sprinklers to water the grass and a pipe under our bathroom bursted and flooded the whole room. Running around like crazy we gathered our stuff and they gave us another room which was much smaller and next to a gate that anyone can walk in and out of all day. I didnt feel safe so we had to move AGAIN and this time they put us on the 3rd floor. I was not happy at all. From all the moving I was exhausted so we ended our day early. Very disappointed. Tried to take a shower to go to bed and there was no hot water, im guessing from the flood in our room they had to turn off the water supply. Very aggrevating. The front desk did offer to dry out our clothes but only gave us half off our first night stay which I thought was not good enough for the inconvinience. The area is also kind of scary at night. Lots of bums on the street, they do have a security guard at night though.

Reviews.Title: “MCRD. Friendly, Accomodating Staff Aimed to please. Affordable and Clean.”
Reviews.Author: JDH_Texas
Reviews.Content: I flew to San Diego to see my son graduate at the Marine Corps Recruit Depot. I stayed 2 nights at the Days Inn at 3350 Rosecrans St. and EVERYone on staff seemed to take a personal interest in making my stay the best possible. The Manager (Richard) should be very pleased with the staff there. I have spoken with him on the phone to make sure he was aware, but also wanted the general public aware as well. At the front desk I was greeted by Yessica who could brighten your day with just her smile. She was also very knowledgeable of the areas sights, places to dine, and attractions. Chris (who drove the Shuttle bus to the MCRD and back among other places) was most professional, went out of his way to accomodate, let everyone know that he appreciated our graduating Marine's service to our country, and of course was very knowledgeable of the areas sights, attractions, and places to dine. I was treated by every staff member that I encountered as if they were pleased to see me, glad that I was there, and that if there WAS a problem that it would be taken care of promptly. I would recommend the Days Inn at 3350 Rosecrans to any of the families that are going to an MCRD graduation or any other event in the San Diego area. NOTE: I had ex in laws stay at a different hotel chain on the beach with higher rates that were envious of the service, rates, and condition/spaciousness of the room that I had. It's NOT a snobby,uncomfortable,"Palace Hotel". It IS a comfortable, affordable, friendly place to stay that will have you feeling as if you've just made friends. Thanks for the stay. J

Reviews.Title: “Decent Cheap Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sneeker635
Reviews.Content: We came to San Diego to take our 5 year old to the zoo and we wanted to stay somewhere cheap that was kid friendly. This hotel is exactly that, cheap and kid friendly. I read reviews previous to our stay and I was a little worried but everything was fine once we arrived. There were no sketchy people hanging around, just the families that were staying there. The room itself was basic nothing special, but again, it's a days inn. The room was clean, the only complaint was the smell from the A/C. The pool was heated so that was good for the kids. The continental breakfast did have hot food, eggs, hash browns, and pancakes. It was just alright, not the best but it was free. The internet and parking were free too and that is rare in southern CA. Overall it was a decent cheap stay. You can't expect luxury at the Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Is this hotel dirty?”
Reviews.Author: almsmcq
Reviews.Content: The interior of the room was just fine. It's not new, but was not dirty and as gross as I've read in other reviews. An effort was made to provide some decor and make the best use of the space to the comfort of it's guests. I did not do my research BEFORE booking (I ended up doing it while we were there during "#ell-night")--this was a spur of the moment trip to SeaWorld and since we live in LA, I just needed something close to the park for the night. This wasn't even the cheapest hotel available. I paid twice the lowest local rate and expected that there was some ascending quality built into that especially since I booked into the suites side of the hotel-assuming that this would be a even more of an upgrade in quality and privacy which turned out to be a wrong assumption. We arrived in the daytime, and I knew there was something off when we had to cross a back street to an unsecured lot, with unsecured stair access to our room where there were some people laying around in the lot and alley. We returned from the park after dark and on the way from the freeway noticed the GIANT strip club not too far from the hotel. And then the OTHER giant strip club. And the adult shops. We live in LA. We're not prudes. But when a hotel has a family-friendly themepark as part of its name, it better not be across from a t!tty-bar. Or a regular bar that plays live, loud music until 2 am that echos into your balcony area. When that shuts down you can finally have a moment's silence to enjoy the sound of your neighbors doing stuff with the call girls they've invited back to the room through the paper-thing walls. How do you know it's a call girl? It's when the hotel door shuts and a single, clacking pair of heels heads back down to the parking lot. Over and over again. All night long. Toss in a bunch of shady characters milling about in the open hallways earlier in the evening and I would describe our evening in this hotel as waiting out a Zombie-apocolypse. Just turn off the lights, lock the doors and pray you make it to daylight. So, is this hotel dirty? Not in the way that is the cleaning staff's responsiblity. The hotel has 2 very diverse clientel, which is not their fault. I just think the management should make the best effort to keep families in the main hotel, and let the usecured suites area be the domain of the rowdier folks who won't mind the loud music or overhearing *stuff* into the wee hours.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: looking4sun55
Reviews.Content: OK so they say they have a shuttle. However, when you call they say it is based on availability. I guess it is just never available. We took a shuttle ($16) from the cruise port to the airport because they said they picked up at the air port. So we called them from the airport and were put on hold for 15 minutes. So we called on another line and got right thru. However they told us we would have to wiat 5 hours until the shuttle was available. So we took a taxi from the airport another 18 bucks to the hotel. When we arived at the hotel we were told we would have to wait 5 hours for a room. Sometimes cheap rooms are not so cheap. Even when you ask the right questions there is not garantee you are being told the honest answers.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Decent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: y0ungseni0rcitizen
Reviews.Content: I read a few of the other reviews. This staff went out of their way to help and if there was an issue, it could be rectified. Cleanliness was fine- absolutely no issue. Was the furniture showing its age- yes- just like me. But,without a doubt, this was a clean room. The shuttle service was good, and frankly very friendly. Just make sure you book in advance as they suggest. And regarding location-Safety just was not an issue at all. No this is not a Harbor view but if you want to save money big time, this is not a bad choice. One suggestion I would make is to book a room away from the steps and further away from the parking lot. By the way, the parking lot is totally safe.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this Day's Inn in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: LisafromUtah
Reviews.Content: I am writing today to let everyone know to STAY AWAY from the Days Inn San Diego near Sea World. It had to be the WORST hotel we have EVER, and may I emphasis EVER, stayed at! After we had checked in and got our room key we went to our room, arms loaded with our luggage, and found that the clerk had given us the wrong room. She was friendly though and gave us the right room. As we walked into the room there was a terrible odor. It seemed as though the room had never been cleaned. But it looked ok and so we stayed. Later that evening as we were preparing for bed I took my socks off and of course they were black, which was grose but have had that problem before in a hotel. As I went to turn on the light near the bed a horrible odor came from the carpet near the bed. Everytime I turned over in the night I'd smell that horrible smell. I have no ideas what it was. 2 days after we checked in the toilet broke and we had to Manuel flush the toilet until they came to fix it, which was later that day. The very next morning the light over the sink, which is where you have to do your hair, burnt out. So we called the front office and they sent a repair man to replace it a half hour later. Which irritated me because we were trying to get out of the hotel to go to Sea World. But that wasn't even the worst thing. The very next morning, 3 days after we checked in we went to get in the shower to get ready for the day and there was NO HOT WATER!! We contacted the front desk and they informed us that the boiler had gone out and there was no hot water. They told us that they had some rooms available across the street that we could go shower in. So we had to load up all our personal products and trapes across the street to shower. Let me tell you it was a big hassle. When we returned that evening from our daily activities there still was no hot water. The front desk told us it wasn't fixed yet but should be in the morning. Which of course it wasn't so once again we had to load all our personal stuff up and trapes across the street to shower but this day it was raining so that made it ever worse. By this time I had had it with this dump and began to look around the area for another hotel. There was hardly any rooms available and the ones that were available were very expensive. So I couldn't afford to change hotels. Which really made me livid. We asked them if they would move us into two rooms across the street, with hot water, that had adjoining doors but they said they couldn't do that. Much later that evening the water was finally fixed and we were able to have a warm shower that next day. But when I showered the following day there STILL was no hot water. I refused to pay full price for that hotel and told the front desk that I wanted a discount for the inconvience their hotel caused me. They told me that they could give me a 25% discount off two of the days. Which was only a measly $30. I refused that offer and told them I wanted the suite room for the cost of a regular room. The clerk said she'd have to talk to the manager. After some wheeling and dealing they finally agreed to my offer. Which saved me much more than their first offer but even that wasn't worth the problems we endured at this HORRIBLE hotel. I would NEVER, EVER, EVER stay at the Days inn near Sea World again. Not only was our room terrible but the breakfast was horrible too. There was usually only one lady who cooked and served the breakfast. So we usually had to wait for 10 or 15 minutes to get our food. Even then it wasnâ€™t that great tasting The breakfast room also had a absolutely terrible smell. Many mornings I felt like throwing up because it stunk so bad. Even the terrible area it is located in doesn't compare to how rotten that dive of a hotel is. Bums everywhere, nude bars on every corner, and panhandlers on every street don't even come close to explaining what a scummy place this hotel is. Day's Inn should not even want their name associated with this hotel. I would be embarrased to say this hotel was in my chain of hotels. It's a good thing I've stayed at Day's Inn before because if this was my first time it would have definatly been my last!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for our family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Mandi32
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was awesome. The staff was amazing and helpful and it was so handy to have a kitchenette for two young/small children! We are planning another vacation to San Diego and will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Corsairjet
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel at all cost. The air conditioner did not cool the room. Had to leave the window open. Stained bedspread and ugly odor in the room (smoke, who knows what else!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: ramirez0715
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stay here. They offer a free breakfast. This is not your typical danish They offer pancakes, eggs, toast, muffins, and cereal. great location near other family style restaurants and near Sea World. Will keep coming back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chipmapa
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a handicapped adult and the staff went out of their way to help us out,even moving us closer to the office in case we needed assistance. The room was very clean and all of the staff was very friendly and felt like family. The only problem we had was when we were getting ready to leave very early and the office called saying we would have to take a taxi to the airport to get there in time. I spoke to one of the shuttle drivers and was told that we didn't need to that is what they were there for. The shuttle is a free service for this hotel and should be available all of the time for its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: loki25
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good choice because the rooms where great but the t.v's could always be a little better. Cleanliness was very good and the maids stop by every morning. One time I was asked about five times to have my room cleaned but i wasn't going anywhere. This location is pretty much perfect since you have sea world right next door with a free ride to there. Also there are plenty of stores and restraunts close by within a five minute walk. the costumer service was also great. About within a few minuts I got my room key and was in my room. Overall I would recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: scrapper77
Reviews.Content: We cruised from Vancouver to San Diego, then stayed at the Days Inn for 3 nights to see the town. They offer a shuttle to anywhere you could possibly want to go, which is huge savings. Althought they ran a little behind schedule due to traffic, the drivers were very friendly and extrememly accommodating. The staff at the front desk of the hotel was also very friendly and informative. The room was clean, and they had close to 100 channels on the TV, plus movies to order. We only had a quick dip in the pool because it was crowded, but it seemed very nice. It has two shallow ends, which I think people with kids enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: dpwr
Reviews.Content: We had no problems staying at this hotel. It was clean and the staff was great. It is close to downtown. The price is reasonable too.

Reviews.Title: “We found our stay great!!”
Reviews.Author: lori1429
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to the hotel the front desk clerk was not very personable but after a few minutes she seemed to warm up. I did not let that first impression make any sort of impact on me. I thought the hotel was clean, had everything we needed & most importantly the kids had fun in the pool. It is very centrally located for everything we needed. Close shopping and all freeway exits but everything you need is within walking distance. The added bonus of the hot breakfast was more than we could have asked for. I will not dispute that fact that there are some areas of the hotel that do need updating but I am certain that will come. I would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel from MCRD Graduation”
Reviews.Author: Ethansmommy2008
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great location for the MCRD San Diago Graduation and family day. THe shuttle service was free and also offered shuttle service to area attractions. The pool was great and heated. Breakfast was great as well. We traveled with family and a small child and had everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “I was more than satisfied”
Reviews.Author: mmoreno62
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Days Inn & Suites and was absolutely content with my stay. The room was clean, and the staff were wonderful. They were very attentive, and made me feel at home. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: HappyMike3
Reviews.Content: Rooms need to be updated and carpets replaced. Sofa beds need new mattress. Breakfast is a joke. The entire hotel shows up and they try to cook the full breakfast. If you want to wait in a line for about 40 minutes and hope they have food when you get there. Was out of coffee, milk, juice. Front desk must not communciate to the cook staff about numbers of people. The breakfast room is not attended. Tables dirty and food all over the floor. Lots of young families with small children. Only good point was the staff in the laundry room was very pleasant with more towels.

Reviews.Title: “crap”
Reviews.Author: Someone77
Reviews.Content: this place sucks dont stay here if you have kids the room was disgusting the carpet was filthy the room smelled horrible the guy at the front desk oscar had a bad attitude he was un proffesional the room was very very noisy the parking was terrible homeless people all around what you see online is not what you get dont stay here this was the worst hotel we ever stayed at

Reviews.Title: “OMG - BEWARE of this hotel, I was mortified”
Reviews.Author: flygal711
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me start off by saying I have been a flight attendant for a major US airline for 20+ yrs. I say this because I feel I have a way higher "tolerance" than most people for sub-standard hotel rooms, and I have travelled ALL over and stayed in lots of questionable hotels. This hotel was BY FAR the worst one I have ever stayed in in my life. I was completely mortified when we walked in to the room. The pix online of this hotel made it look really nice, website boasted of a "full" free breakfast, suites, etc. The room was horrendous. We had to walk about a half a block behind the hotel and cross a street (w homeless people everywhere) to get to our room. Our room was very dirty, carpet was dirty, very bare bones furniture. The sink was literally RIGHT in the room with the bed. I was extrememly nervous that there wa bugs/cockroaches in room. I have never ever left a hotel and switched because I have been disappointed and let me tell you I was very close to leaving this hotel. The "free" breakfast was a complete JOKE: 1 type of cereal every day (corn flakes) No pastries or donuts, 1 type of eggs every day (scrambled) and pancakes only (I was told they had waffles when I called hotel when I was booking trip), 1 fruit every day only (very small oranges in a bowl), and only 1 type of instant oatmeal (plain), 1 type of juice every day (OJ), No toppings for oatmeal, no fresh fruit cut up, no variety in cereal, no bacon or sausage, no yogurt, etc. Everything was served on styrfoam plates w/ plastic utensils. I know I am coming off as sounding like a Prima Donna which I am not. But I have stayed at plenty of hotels that have had FREE continental breakfasts and they had so much more variety than this hotel. A couple times I had to go to the front desk at night after dark, and I was very nervous walking across street and through parking lot to the front desk area. I could tell even my kids were horrified at the room and the hotel. The pool area was very dirty (towels EVERYWHERE) and the pool itself was dirty. The laundry room was disgusting also. I would never ever recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: travelerWailuku_Maui
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to many places and stayed at a wide-variety of places. This is by far the worse place I have ever stayed at. Upon check-in we were told that our room was canceled. Upon explaining to the front desk person that we didn't cancel anything and that we had the reservation information, etc. we were still told, "Well you must have because we didn't do it." The front desk person was the rudest employee I have ever encountered in all my years of travel. After finally being able to speak to someone else, it was soon discovered that it was the hotels mistake. When we got to the room we found the carpet to be filthy; bedding to be nasty; laundry room to have rubbish everywhere; bathroom to be usable (but that's the extent of it); jacuzzi filled with bubbles; pool having to be cleaned because other hotel guests poured something in it; and a woman who appeared to be participating in "adult entertainment" in an upstairs bedroom. Not to mention it was in a shady part of the neighborhood with strip bars galore and we needed to be extra sure to lock everything and hide everything before leaving the room. If you have no standards, and just need a place to stay. This is it. But if you are staying with your family, choose another place. They have TONS to choose from in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a day or two”
Reviews.Author: Hotellybelly
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with my family and 2 younger cousins, we asked for adjoining rooms but did not get them. the rooms are small, stinky, and dirty. beds were somewhat comfortable but not the best. the curtains on the windows were very heavy and made the room very dark. the maid service was OK but they took the towels, including the ones we didnt use and left us without any. the shower was really hot and i could not get it to cool down, the coffee was gross but thats to be expected at a cheap hotel. it was nice for the price, we payed around 60 dollars a night for it, it was close to sea world and not too far from the beach. the area its in is a little loud and there were people on the street who would sit in the parking lot and yell at eachother, the cops got called once or twice in the 5 days we stayed there because of some people downstairs fighting with the manager. one tip, dont use the ice machine( if they still even have it ) it turned the ice a brownish color and it was covered in dust because it was shoved in a corner. it was ok to stay in for a day or two but if you want to stay any longer id reccomend paying a few bucks more and being comfortable somewhere else. i wouldnt leave children alone here.

Reviews.Title: “average quality”
Reviews.Author: d3040
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some pros and cons: Pros: 1. Good , steaming complimentary breakfast fresh off the stove, 2. 10 minutes to most places of attraction in San Diego. Cons: 1. Very poor service,we booked a non smoking room but were given a smoking room, due to overbooking. Room was very very bad, enough to ruin the stay for us, it smelled, and the bed spread had what looked like a burnt hole . 2. The bathroom tub faucet took 20 minutes to let out hot water and there was no hot water from the shower faucet. The last thing you need when you get back from a day of sightseeing is to struggle with the bath. 3. The parking spaces are not well designed, too little room to maneuver a compact car.

Reviews.Title: “What a stay”
Reviews.Author: 11Mike
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews and what the hotel had to offer, we made the choice to stay here. If I would have looked into the area more and listened to my mom, we would have booked a room on Hotel Circle instead. There were easily 3-4 strip clubs within walking distance, not good when you have small children. Along the side of the hotel that faces Midway, there is a wall that seperates the hotel from an old car lot, the homeless like to hang out behind that wall. I had to call the front office due to missing tv remotes and the cable tv being fuzzy. The a/c units were very old and made one hell of a noise when you run them. I also had to kill a rather large roach in my room. The only plus was the breakfast and the staff. The breakfast was freash and made to order and the staf were nice. Ok place to stay if you are looking to party but not really a family place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go!”
Reviews.Author: catashley
Reviews.Content: Even after reading some of the reviews of this hotel I still booked a room for several days in hopes they were wrong. Well they weren't! If you plan the hotel to be a pleasant destination part of your trip DO NOT stay here. It is very noisy (thin walls), in a very bad part of town (homeless camp next door), pool and jacuzzi is dirty, carpet on room floor is sticky/dirty (wear shoes) and breakfast is poor and not as advertised (stood in line over twenty minutes for breakfast one morning). There are so many other choices to stay in San Diego and for the same price. Don't ruin your visit to this beautiful city by staying here. Sorry Days Inn, but it's the truth.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and good place for kids”
Reviews.Author: Kerry&Mary
Reviews.Content: Reasonable kid friendly pool and spa that allows kids to make noise and enjoy. Great breakfast gets the day started right. Free shuttle to various places make visits to major attractions cheaper with no parking and easy as well. Good staff and good value room. The suites made it easy for the kids to fall asleep after a full day and us to enjoy a area of our own in the evenings. Close places to eat and shop for food makes the refrig and microwave valuable to keep expense down and meals more healthy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For Kids”
Reviews.Author: monicas222
Reviews.Content: It was clean and FULL of kids of all ages. It could get a bit noisy but at 10 pm the staff made sure it got quiet fast. When a toilet became backed up, a maintenance person was at our room within 10 minutes and had it cleared in 5 minutes. Very friendly staff. Breaakfast was nice and a big money saver as i came with 3 teenagers. the pool was great but the location was awesome. Write near the beaches and quick access to the freeways...just a few miles from the airport. If you want peace and quiet this may not be it because of so many kds. Parking lot is small and hard to navigate in big cars.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go, it is bad!”
Reviews.Author: WyomingMardell1
Reviews.Content: Dirty! First the sheets on the pull out couch were not clean. When checking out we checked under the bed in the bedroom only to find that it was dirty and even had an old sock under there. The hot tub was gross... looked like a bubble machine... do people not know that this is not what it should look like... it is not a bubble bath! Learn how to clean and chemical properly! The pool didn't look much better. We didn't have enough towels for the 6 of us, but they never brought them. Oh, and the shower was lukewarm at best.... it never got hotter at all. All I can say is YUCK!!!! I do not understand their lack of cleanliness. It is very dated as well. I would never recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms were a little dirty. The carpet...”
Reviews.Author: ponsfam
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a little dirty. The carpet was absolutely in need of replacing in all suites. The hot water would run out on you in two minutes. I had the feeling that management has notified the owner but they don't care due to the volume of people coming through. The air conditioning likes to volition also. Parking is the worst unless you have a compact. It is located in a not so good part of town, so lock your doors! There are better deals on hotels closer to Sea World. We had two suites located on opposite sides of the property and I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “wasnt that bad”
Reviews.Author: TiffanyDriver
Reviews.Content: reading endless reviews of this hotel made us wary of staying here. but really it wasnt that bad. the room was modern, everything worked, plenty of pillows and towels and friendly staff. we tried the breakfast one morning and you could see the ladies making everything. id definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Money”
Reviews.Author: byvette
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Jan. 30th, 2010 for two nights before a cruise out of San Diego. It was a great stay. Room was clean and bed very comfortable. Front desk was very nice and helpful. The free shuttle to the Zoo and Seaworld and to the port for our cruise, really topped my stay. There was a hot breakfast of eggs and pancakes, also bagels and toast, fruit, coffee and juice. Great for the money spend. Also I TV went on the blink , we called the front desk and they came up right away. When they couldnt fix it, they replaced it. Great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “3 stays already. Returning again next month”
Reviews.Author: weekend_traveler_9
Reviews.Content: Each time we had a good time here. Location may not seem so safe but never had problem with break ins to our car. Did see some people sleeping in their car on street here. Twice we got here before noon and they offered early check in. Staff was great. Breakfast was fair and hot. Pool noise was common with some type guests. Overall a great place to stay. We enjoy this place so much we are booked here again next month and then again 3 months later.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value if on a Budget !”
Reviews.Author: Worldtravenut
Reviews.Content: This place is great if you don`t want to spend a fortune. Rooms very comfortable,good shuttle service to attaractions. Local bus stop just outside for 5 min trip to Old Town Transit Center. Some posts thought the area was bad. It was fine with shops and restaurants within 2 min walk..... Just be cautious as few homeless around but don`t really bother you .( However the Hotel consists of 2 Buildings and it is a bit creepy walking between the Two across a dark street which bisects the site if you need to get to the laundry room at night but Security Guy is around in Parking Lot or Near Reception ). Cooked Breakfast is smallish but there are cereals......Staff very friendly and hotel is excellent value especially if you pre pay. I would stay here again to save a few $ !!

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful”
Reviews.Author: momof2marines
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews so I was a bit iffy about this place, but when I got there I was very surprised. I was in town for a marine graduation and the girls at the desk were very helpful. I really had never travelled here before so I didn't know anything. It seemed reasonable, if i used the shuttle I scheduled the pick up st the same time because it was "limited service" (meaning first come first serve) The blond manager at the desk was a wealth of knowledge everytime I went up she was able to help me. Chris the driver was great too. The area didn't seem the best but there isnt much management can do about it except having security walk the property (which they do) They are set on two differen tlots, regular rooms in the front and suites in back building. All in all it wasa pretty good stay

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Hao60201
Reviews.Content: 1. Bad neighborhood. Loud music from a nearby bar called "Rhythm Lounge" whole saturday night until 2 am. Stripper bars nearby. 2. Poor management. a. Water shutoff for planned repair several hours monday afternoon without giving any prior notice. Even a sign at the entrance would have done the job. b. Laundry door locked at 8pm with our laundary inside while the laundry hour was posted 9am-10pm. c. It took repeated calls to frontdesk and running-around in the building looking for the janitor to get the door unlocked after half a hour. d. Again the next day, the door was locked at 9:50pm with our laundry in the dryer. The dryer was still working so the janitor absolutely knew there was laundry inside. This time I was lucky to locate the janitor around the pool five minutes later. e. Teenages hanging around the pool area which made us feel unsafe. 3. Terrible employees. a. Full of lies. When asked about the spare key for laundry room, Frontdesk claimed there is only one laundry key and janitor had it at that time so there was no way she could be of any help. If that were of truth, then this property would have broken the fire code thousands of time. Also she kept saying there were other guest calls for service and the janitor was dealing with them. I happen to find out the janitor was not servicing anyone but doing some normal maintenance the whole time. The frontdesk also denied any accountabilities for the water shutdown saying it was not foreseeable. But the truth is that when we arrived two days before which was a Saturday we already noticed there was water leaking at the building basefloor and cones placed around the leakage. My guess is that they didn't shutoff the water to repair because the high occupancy during weekend. They picked the following Monday. So they knew it ahead but because of the bad management they failed to notice guests. When people complained they just denied. b. Janitors incredibly ... how to I put it? crazy? Who in there clear mind would lock the laundry door during laundry hours without checking? Who would lock the laundry door at 9:50 while hearing the dryer running?

Reviews.Title: “Pay the extra money to stay somewhere else-Seriously!”
Reviews.Author: AzGirl71
Reviews.Content: Okay so we thought how bad could this hotel be? we booked our room thinking maybe people expected too much for the price.we were just needing a place to sleep.No one tells you you have at least 5 nudie bars/clubs within a mile radius or that as you pull into the hotel you have to make sure you dont hit the group of the homeless that are hanging out in the hotel driveway.maybe if you are with a large group of family/friends it wouldnt be so creepy.i wanted to leave before we ever checked in! The room was good for the price,clean and housekeeping was very kind.the pool area is pretty small.normally we wouldnt care about the pool but the weather was a bit cooler and my 7yr old wanted to swim.Free breakfast was ok,you get what you pay for :) Also whatever you do dont make the mistake of ordering takeout from the paper that the so called great deal pizza place slips under your door.you might as well walk outside and give someone your $30. Im usually not a complainer, i love san diego and have never written a review but i felt i needed to warn the next family that wants to save a few bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Place”
Reviews.Author: parisalley
Reviews.Content: Pictures look great but once you get there it is not. Moldy smell in rooms ,old air system very loud, refrigarator junk,couch lumpy, carpet dirty, ice machine broken, that is enough do I need to say more!!!!! Issues not really taken care of and I wonder if they really have security...???? Very noisey all hours of the night and morning. I really think the staff is pretty much there for the check and not a care in the world for the visitors!!!! The breakfast was good but tables and room need to be cleaner!!!! If you are on spring break and want to be loud this is the place to beeeee!!!!! If not trysomeplace else!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotel1000
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump. The only reason we did not check out of this hotel is because we had an airport/hotel package. The pictures on the internet were very decieving.They made the hotel and pool look clean and much bigger then they are. Nothing in that hotel was modern, and it needs major renovation. The breakfast tables were limited , and we often found ourselves trying to find a seat for four, and when we did get a table, it wobbled everytime we moved. They needed more staff serving breakfast, because the line was very long. The food they offered was average, but the service wasnt very friendly, and most of the time, they ran out of certain food every day. The maids were not very friendly, and we had to call room service for towels at least twice during our stay. Our room was very dissapointing. We saw that some rooms had microwaves and fridges, but ours had none. The carpets definitely needed to be cleaned, and the sofa bed was old and dirty. The pool is 1/3 the size if the pictures shown, and it was dirty and cold. The pool was used after 10, and we heard all the noise from the children way into the night. The neighborhood was shady. We wanted to use a healthclub, and there was none around. They claimed a discount to a nearby gym, but no one at the front desk knew anything about it. The only things going for this hotel was the proximity to Old Town and the shuttle service. The shuttle service was flexible, and the drivers were very pleasant. Overall, our experience was very unsatisfactory. We would not stay here or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money!!”
Reviews.Author: birkeebabe
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a breeze and friendly. The room was satisfactory. Minus the carpets that needed some cleaning. The sliding door was nice to let some of the fresh San Diego air in while we relaxed watching tv. We didnâ€™t use the pool or spa because it was overun with lots of kids which is fine it is summer, and a time to have fun!! Everyone looked to be enjoying themselves! It was quiet around the hotel. Breakfast in the morning was fast, friendly and plentiful. Never had to wait a long time for the hot food. Nice large area to eat too which was nice to have One of the perks which was great was a free shuttle to Sea World! The drivers we had were super friendly and helpful. We were traveling with my mom who is in a wheelchair and the were helpful with her too. Some things looked run down but overall would stay here again. Close to lots of attractions and a free shuttle canâ€™t beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gopherlips
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Days Inn for 4 nights in July and found the hotel to be very accomodating. We were a group of 6 that needed a suite and this was one of the only hotels that would offer this type of room. There is a free breakfast every morning that consists of pancakes, eggs, bagels, cereal, orange and apple juice, and coffee. Yes, it is the same every day - yes it is mundane...yes it is free so quit complaining. When we arrived, the internet service we used had booked us the wrong room, but the front desk did a great job and got us what we needed. Pool is small and cold, but is in the interior of the buildings, so it is a little safer than an exposed pool on the back of a hotel. Shuttle service is accomodating and free to local attractions. They have a discount program with a nationally recognized car rental company, so talk to them before renting on your own - it was cheaper than anything else I found. all in all a good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Low Budget for price”
Reviews.Author: kashmir_0001
Reviews.Content: My husband is disabled and I had written a request when I booked the room for a ground level room. I booked our room early in the season so there was no excuse for them not giving us a ground level room. Of course when we arrived they could not give us a ground level room "because they were booked 100%". They did have a filthy elevator that we had to use to get to our 3rd floor room. The room was sub par. I have been in much nicer rooms for much less cost. Every time we left and returned to the room we would have to turn off the AC because it kept defaulting to 66 degrees. It was moist and cold and smelled moldy in the room every time we came back. Also saw homeless defecating behind the hotel. We would never stay there again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay thanks to shuttle staff and others”
Reviews.Author: MartyPN
Reviews.Content: It may sound strange but the best thing about this place was that we did not have a car and were reliant upon the fantastic shuttle drivers Tim, Gretchen and Chris for transport. In reception Christina and Tasha also were very helpful. After reading a number of bad reviews, most of which were in our opinion unjustified, we were slightly on edge about staying at the accommodation. This was further compounded when a mix up saw our accommodation unavailable for the first night of our booking. The staff quickly found us accommodation nearby at the Days Inn expense and refunded a nights accommodation, dropped us off and picked us up next day from the alternative accomodation. From there on in nothing was a problem for the reception and shuttle staff who ensured our stay was enjoyable. The suite itself was nothing special, being somewhat dated in appearance. However, it was clean and the staff ensured that it was kept clean and well serviced. One problem that was experienced was the hot water shower needed to be set in a different position it seemed each day, but once you figured this out there always was adeqaute hot water. At the recommendation of the reception staff they located us on the top floor to provide for minimum noise. The beds were comfortable and the lounge area was a reasonable size and enabled us to put our daughter to bed and stay up a little later. The air conditioning was effective but a little noisy and we were glad we did not have it on all night. On the ground floor was the swimming pool, of reasonable proportions and adequatley heated and a spa pool. Some evenings it was a little noisy but if you went to bed the fact of having the lounge between you and the pool made it quiet enough. The breakfast was okay considering they were cooking for more than 400 people each day. It depended upon who was cooking what the serivce was like. The male cook always had a full tip jar and this was because he provided the best service. The women cooks were never tipped as much. As stated earlier, not having a car meant that we were reliant upon a shuttle. Tim, Gretchen and Chris were excellent in providing information about San Diego and were only to willing to get you to where you wanted to go and pick you up. There were some who complained that they got left behind because they turned up 10 minutes late to be picked up, but when you consider that the drivers needed to go on and get guests from other locations such criticism of the drivers was completely unjustified. If you were there on time you could guarantee they would be there also. One night we wanted to go to church and they dropped us off there on the way back to the accommodation from the zoo. Nothing was a problem for them and they became good friends, making our stay very enjoyable. One excellent aspect about the location was the proximity to HenrysMarket across the road. This was an excellent location to buy friut and bakery products at a great price. If you needed food then this was definitely the place to head for quality and service that surpassed the other supermarkets in the area. Also across the way were several reasonably priced restaurant/take out eateries and a bank that had helpful staff. Previous comments about the homeless being in the area were correct, but our experience was that with only one exception they were friendly and in the main ignored the residents of the hotel. We did not experience any problems with the homeless and the police came by every so often and chatted to them. We did not feel unsafe at all. As for the woman who said the rooms were filthy and their child got black feet off the carpet, she needs to realise that if you let your child run around on the seal outside that this is where you get black feet from, not the carpets in the suites. The worst thing about the place were some of the difficult and demanding clients who probably read the negative reviews and decided to be just as difficult. Essentially you get more than what you pay for, especially if you use the shuttle. If you were on a budget and without transport this accommodation was very good value and I would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Carpets need cleaning!!”
Reviews.Author: vard77
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay here was good , we stayed for 4 nights and the location for sea world , the zoo , the harbour and the airport is very good. They provide a cooked breakfast every morning , toast , pancakes , scrambled eggs , cereals , muffins , danish , coffee & juice. The pool and the hot tub are both clean and pleasant to use , house keeping clean the rooms and change bedding and towels every day aswell. We stayed in a suite which is located in a seperate building behind the main building and the bedroom was a seperate room to the main living area which is seperated by a door , the main living area had a tv , sofa , fridge , microwave and table with 2 chairs. They also provide free wifi which was a pretty good connection and speed. The only down side which for me was quite a concern , the carpets in the rooms are filthy! I have a baby who is crawling and her knees , feet ,hands and clothes were black after being on the floor for even a few minutes. The management of this property really need to invest some money into getting the carpets replaced or steam cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was horrible”
Reviews.Author: ladym128
Reviews.Content: The room was very small. The couch was so old, the cushions tiled forward and you felt like you were going to fall off of it. The a/c was very confusing to figure out....The first night, we could hear people having sex through the paper thin walls. The next night on the other side, kids were jumping around and screaming after 10 p.m. The walkways were filthy and we felt unsafe here. The bathroom was so small, you could not hardly move in it. The faucets were not normal to the shower and difficult to figure out. Our maid was very unfriendly and would hardly give us but two cups a day for use and very few towels. This was in a rather shabby neighborhood. The front desk was not very friendly either. Days Inn should be ashamed to have this hotel under their name. I would never stay here again! The only reason we stayed is because we made the reservations under expedia and pictures showed a very nice looking hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You definitely get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: bgbstg17
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel on cheaphotels.com for $54 a night. Let's just say, you definitely get what you pay for. The vending machine room and most of the room hallways are pretty dirty and in need of renovation. The free breakfast that was advertised was only free because no one in their right mind would pay for it. No meat was offered, only pancakes, burnt toast, or eggs. I needed the internet to complete some work online, and they advertised complimentary internet in each room. However, when I tried to connect, either it wouldn't connect or it was so slow that usually my web pages timed out. I even called the front desk to ask about this, and they only said that it should be working. If you were a college student looking for a place to have a hotel party, I would recommend Days Inn. Otherwise, spring for something a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Close to MCRD/Shuttle to meet our U.S. Marine”
Reviews.Author: youngset
Reviews.Content: A great place to go if you have a graduating Marine! Two shuttle vans running every 15 minutes for an hour to and from... first come first serve. We reserved a 2 room suite, 2 full size beds and one sofa bed, The only downers: The sofa bed was not comfortable due to the springs & no children channels.... Some plus factors: The rooms are a comfortable size, staff very helpful. Nice swimming area... clean over all. We had a great time. really close to stores. Security on site 24/7 We felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff, great value”
Reviews.Author: Finndian
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending 7 days in San Diego at the Days Inn on Rosecrans Street. We couldn't have had a more positive experience. Being on a tight budget, we researched lodging that was affordable, near Old Town and the major attractions. We had a suite which provided us enough room to be comfortable. The hotel provided a shuttle that took us to Sea World, the Zoo, the Harbor and back to the airport. The shuttle drivers are outstanding!! The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and the breakfast was ample. The hotel is within easy walking distance to Old Town, restaurants and some shopping. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn Horror”
Reviews.Author: richmar12
Reviews.Content: We arrived to a couple standing by the entrance about to have sex. That should've have sent us out of there, but we had already pre paid for the hotel room. We walked in and the smell was so bad. It was musty and disgusting. I had to open all the windows and balcony to try and get the smell out. We had air freshener that didn't help. We went to Target which was close by to buy something to help us with the smell. We were hoping to find some Febreeze, but no luck. I ended up buying some spray plug in. It helped a little, but not much. We had to stay there for 2 nights. The water temperature was very inconsistent. First you'd have nice and hot water and 2 seconds later you would have hotter water. When you would turn up the cold, it would be freezing water. For some reason, we didn't change rooms. The only good thing was the breakfast. That's it! It's not worth getting a good deal just for the breakfast. Don't stay here! I've never done these reviews before. I've read them and seen alot of mixed reviews. My suggestion is please do not stay here for your sake. Just don't !!

Reviews.Title: “No help at all from the Front Desk staff - could really improve customer service”
Reviews.Author: jennyevans
Reviews.Content: We have mixed emotions about our stay - we booked on expedia having done a lot of research about places that offered shuttles/breakfast/rooms with space etc. We confirmed our booking from Seaworld and asked about transport to the motel. At no time did they mention that they may have been able to pick us up (ie their shuttle service). Anyway we eventually got a cab (which was great value - only US$10 from Seaworld to the door. We found the room to be very basic, but very suitable for our needs, and quite clean. The room had a separate bedroom area which worked really well for our family. Also there was plenty of room for luggage. The shower was ok and in line with what we found throughout our US trip (a bit different from australian showers!) There was no ironing board, and we rang the front desk about this. They said they would bring one but it never arrived. Breakfast was made to order which was nice, but very very limited (scrambled eggs or pancakes). You could get seconds if you asked. We were so disappointed at the end of our stay, when we needed to get to the airport. We had pre-booked the shuttle in plenty of time, but on the day of departure it was pouring rain. We had been placed in the back building over the road from the main reception area, so we had a long way to run in the pouring rain. We asked if the bus could come and collect us in the back street but were told that was not possible. We were all drenched by the time we got to reception!! Our departure was very bland - not one member of staff enquired about whether we had enjoyed our stay, or if there had been any problems. We also had a problem with the laundry. We wanted to do some washing but the laundry on our floor had closed even though the sign said it was open for several more hours.
