We rang the reception and eventually someone agreed to come and unlock the door, after questioning me for some minutes about me being mistaken!! I didn't start out to write this as a scathing report, because we actually didn't mind most things about this motel, especially given the reasonable price. However, we run a motel ourselves, and we can't help but worry about things like customer service. I said to my husband several times that I would not accept this sort of approach from our staff to our guests. Our main problem was really with the front desk staff, who were rude and arrogant and very unhelpful in relation to any concerns that we had. We would be happy to discuss our concerns with management but our request to speak with a manager was denied. We found a couple of great places to eat over the road (one was called Farouz and offered all you can eat for around $12)

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back.”
Reviews.Author: Mel2B
Reviews.Content: We were very unhappy with the hotel when we first arrived. It was late and the hotel was lit poorly with greenish colored bulbs making it appear very unsafe and dirty. Once in our room which was a two room suite, we found the set up very poor. The double beds in the back room barely fit and the door to the front room caught on the corner of the bed making it difficult to open and close the door. The TV's in the rooms were super small and the furniture was very dated. We had a total of 10 in our group so we had two rooms. The other room was two double beds which was too small for my sisterâ€™s family and she had to move to a suite since there are no queen beds. When we attempted to shower we all found the water would vary from absolute cold to scalding hot. We did complain about this and were told the boilers were not functioning properly, but because we needed suites, we could not move to the other building where the water was working. Also, the sink water never got cold only lukewarm. We found the night stand lamp didn't work, the microwave was missing one of the feet and wouldn't stay level because of it. The coffee pot in the room was a single cup maker and they would constantly leave only one packet of coffee; it was a suite that holds 4-6 people! We were on the second floor, and when we would step out onto the walkway, the ground literally would give under our feet. The laundry facility was dirty and we were not able to go into the hot tub because the water was so dirty. The elevator appeared that it would fail at any minute. The place is in serious disrepair and it is in need of a major overhaul. The lobby must have been photo'd with rented furniture or something because the lobby furniture is completely different than the picture. The website pictures show much larger TV's in the rooms and updated carpet and bedding that we did not have. We were so disappointed especially after I made sure to do research on where we would be since I stayed 3 nights and the rest of my family stayed 4. Due to budget, we had to stay otherwise we would have left right away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: rgibson3468
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Days Inn for two nights prior to a five day cruise. Cab cost $16.00 from airport including tip. Room was large, clean and a bit older but nothing too serious. Service at desk was friendly and helpful...had excellent mexican food at Tio Carlos two doors down.... pool was not loud as others claimed, pool hours were 9am-10pm. Only wonky thing was a new water heater was installed so the shower temperature went all over the place but sure it was fixed by now...they offered free shuttle to the cruise terminal so it was a great deal and i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK for what you pay, but...”
Reviews.Author: Tranbjerg
Reviews.Content: I chose the Days Inn & Suites from the price and location. Close to airport, beaches, Seaworld etc. I booked and prepaid through Expedia and got a rate of USD 88 per night incl. tax and breakfast. Not bad in August. I hvave stayed in simlar hotel chains before, so I knew what to expect. OK room with comfortable beds, bath tub, cable TV with HBO etc. What was not so good, was the air condition (old and a bit noisy), the thin walls, the poor pool, the not so efficient staff (why not at least say "thank you" after having stayed for 2 weeks?). All in all it was OK for the money I paid. A big plus was the maintenance and house keeping staff was great. They would come back after 2 minutes, if you had a problem.

Reviews.Title: “My whole family loved.”
Reviews.Author: nicolek6
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for my wedding. I agree, the accommodations were not totally beautiful, but there was still a comfy feel to the place. Plus the price was great. And it was in walking distance to so many tasty mexican restaurants and cute shops. I have fond memories of this hotel, and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of Horrors!!!”
Reviews.Author: kimmierooney
Reviews.Content: This was without a doubt the worst hotel my family and I have ever stayed in. Lobby, rooms, hallways and pool area were filthy. I had booked this hotel based on reviews and pictures of the hotel. I don't understand how some people reviewed it with an above average rating, considering that the hotel looked nothing like the photos on the website. We were traveling with three young men in wheelchairs that need assistance with activies of daily living. I made sure to request either adjoining rooms or rooms that were next to each other. I even had confirmation codes for the reservations I made. When we arrived at the hotel, we found that the young men were booked into a completely different building from the rest of us. The manager advised us that our confirmation codes meant nothing and that there was nothing she could do to help us. We stayed only one night and got out of there the next day. The breakfast buffet they advertised was small and the food was cold. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “been here three times over the last years - all okay except for pool area”
Reviews.Author: Voyager2190
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Days Inn Sea World/Airport three times over the last four years. I always had a room in the second building at the far end with a balcony facing Cauby Street. During my second stay I had an accessible room because the motel was full. I still ask myself how somebody with a wheelchair could navigate in that room because it was totally overstuffed with furniture, so that even I could hardly go to the bathroom at night without hitting anything. POSITIVE about the motel: - It's in an absolute good location to get to downtown San Diego (5 minutes) and other major attractions such as Old Town (2 minutes), SeaWorld (5 minutes), La Jolla (10 minutes), Cabrillo N.M.(5 minutes),... - It has breakfast with choice of two items from: scrambled eggs, pancakes, toast/bagel, cereals,... - good view of the evening fireworks at SeaWorld from the third floor stairway at Riley Street - room size is okay (as long as it's not an accessible room) but no frills (just efficient) -balconies (okay there areno chairs, but you can take one from the room outside) mostly facing side street NEGATIVE: - I had a room in the far corner away from the pool. I believe rooms near the pool (no matter which floor) are quite loud (long pool hours). -> so if you like it quiet, request a room at the far end of the corridor facing Cauley Street. - The pool area is small and not very inviting with old chairs and tables and sometimes even the trash from last days. I would still recommend this motel to people who mainly plan to visit the San Diego area attractions and don't need a nice pool. The location is good and the rates were acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: afterbite
Reviews.Content: The hotel it's ok for the price. The pictures look better than the actual place and we weren't the only people to be disappointed upon arrival. The kids had fun and the people were friendly. But I woke up with bites and even more the next days. It took me a couple of days to realize that I had been bitten by bed bugs and I am covered from head to toes with bites. I just found out that I have to dissinffect everything that I brought home and I don't know if I am going to spread things in my home. I would not go back there. I would pay a little extra and get a cleaner place.

Reviews.Title: “beware !the pictures on the web are deceiving horible horible!!!”
Reviews.Author: vankam2231
Reviews.Content: Poor excuse for a hotel the hallway are filthy dirty and very run down.A very questionable area the hotel is in the skid row area of point loma.Parking was a nightmare .Definetly not a hotel when traveling with kids it was a very unsavory neighborhood felt like a no tell motel. I felt unsafe in the parking lot there was a group of questionable teenage guys hanging around.The room it self was some what clean but the bathroom/shower was very tiny it was the size of a small closet and the sink was outside of the bathroom.We paid for 3 days and we recived a refund for 2 days tried to get our money back for all 3 but the manager and the area manager would not budge they didn't want to refund any of our money even though we only stayed for 20 minutes while we were on the phone with travel agent trying to make other arrangement.I STRONGLY RECOMMEND THAT YOU DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE!!!!!!!!! would not return to this hotel ever.

Reviews.Title: “Not That Bad could have been worse”
Reviews.Author: betheanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in the begining of April. It was a Days Inn and thats what I paid for. The beds were comfortable, plenty of hot water, the complamentary breakfast was good but they could have changed it every day. The location was great, it was located within ten minutes of everything. The shuttle was great. the drivers were friendly and on time. We did not hear any noise from the other rooms or children screaming like the other posts. As for the homeless people they were in the alleys in between but if you look they were everywhere in the city. They did not bother us at all or even say a word . The hotel was not bad for what we needed a bed and a place to shower. We paid for the Days Inn and thats what we got if we payed for the Marriott we would have gotten the marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn Dive”
Reviews.Author: joeblowsandiego
Reviews.Content: Days Inn on Rosecrans appears old, worn and unkempt both on the outside and in the rooms. Parking spaces are the smallest I've ever seen and many full size cars may have to take up a space and a half. The hotel property is bisected by a public street and I observed multiple homeless/transients in the vicinity and on the hotel grounds itself. Breakfast was sub-par and pancakes were frequently served cold. Room smelled of mildew/body odor, screen on the window was damaged from where someone had clearly removed it from the window and jammed it back in place, TV had poor reception and no HBO despite being listed as an offered channel. A/C worked ok. Expect to be woken up at ~6am by shouting/running children and kept up late at night by college age spring breakers. I would never have stayed here if I was charged the full listed rate. Even with a deeply discounted rate I was very tempted to leave. I was surprised to find this level of service at a well established national chain.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised! Great if you're on a Budget!”
Reviews.Author: TinaQ
Reviews.Content: We got a $67 rate online and we weren't really expecting much, but we were very pleasantly surprised by our room. It was big (big enough to play hide and seek with our 5-year old), nicely decorated and clean. Our room also had a microwave and refrigerator which is always a plus when travelling with kids. The hotel is within walking distance of some inexpensive restaurants, we went to Extreme Pizza which was pretty good. The free breakfast was good and included cooked to order eggs. The breakfast room was located in a separate facility behind our building, but it wasn't hard to find. The only challenge was finding the place, coming from Sea World. The google directions were very difficult to follow, especially while exhausted and in an unfamiliar area at night. The motel is on a very large street, it should've been easy to find, so invest in a good map to avoid any problems. Really liked this place. The kids at the front desk were friendly. Ask for room 118!

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: familyoutdoors
Reviews.Content: We Chose Days Inn Sea Word/Airport because it offered a shuttle from the airport to the hotel and also to the cruise terminal. Also because it was affordable and could hold more people (suites). I called the day before we were to leave the airport and was assured that getting the shuttle from the airport would be no problem. Got to the airport and called the hotel only to find that they would not answer the phone. Tried for nearly a half hour when someone suguested we call another Days Inn. They got a hold of the hotel (by radio?) and told us that the shuttle would be to get us in about 15 minutes. After sitting at the airport for over 2 hrs the shuttle finally comes. After arriving at the hotel to check in, we calmly asked why they didn't answer the phone and that we had been waiting for over two hours. The girl at the desk immediately copped an attitude and refused to even help us. We got another employee to help us be she was also rude. Told my husband to sit down and shut up if we wanted to be helped. We were also told we could get our money back and go elsewere. I paid almost three hundred dollars for two rooms. I didn't choose this hotel to be treated like crap. Then they said they didn't even have my reservation after I had confirmed it several times before. They finally found both reservations, but only one room was ready. Checked into that room while they finished cleaning the second room. Made a reservation for the next day's shuttle to take us to the cruise terminal. The rooms were both clean, and somewhat updated. House keeping staff was polite in giving extra towles for pool. Pool is somewhat small but adequate. Hotel is near a Walgreens, Target and shopping center. We ate at the Sizlzler. All within walking distance. I booked this through hotels.com. The price was good for a one nights stay, but I can't say that I would stay at any Days Inn again after the way we were treated. I am in the process of contacting this hotel chain for their comments and to resolve this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price -Great Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelTiffa
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a lovely trip... Ok it looks like the wbsite photos if you squint your eyes and turn your head sideways, but we had a newly remodeled room with tile shower and new marble sink and new faucet, a 2 room suite great for a family of 5, the pool was heated and fun. The breakfast was GREAT! It was homemade and made to order pancakes and eggs and toast. Coffee was good, not great. There is a Walgreens on the corner and a strip club next to that but everything is close there are lots of homeless in Cali, but we didn't find them scary just people down on their luck. We would stay again Loved the Zoo and La Jolla cove wish is would have been warmer

Reviews.Title: “Poor excuse for a suite”
Reviews.Author: turtle8500
Reviews.Content: I would never stay at this hotel again, certainly not with children. My son's socks were black on the bottom. The rooms may have been nice once upon a time, but they are filthy dirty and very run down. It was very noisy until about 4am. The breakfast was not great, made in a small room with no seating and had a line out to the pool. Very expensive for a poor quality "suite". Also, parking at this hotel is a nightmare!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! Horrible! Horrible!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: newlywedliz
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thru [--]. I got it for much cheaper than any what any other website was offering it for. Other sites offered it for 189, i got it for 139. And plus I reserved the Suite. I was looking forward to experience this hotel. My previous stays have been at the Hampton Inn in Las Vegas & San Francisco and they were both wonderful stays there, plus their continental breakfast is wonderful. I expected the same here. This place was horrible. In the front dest they made me sign a form stating that if we smoked we would be fined 300 dollars. When we arrive the the room, it stank of cigarretes!! The courtain had a cigar hole burned on to it. There were ash trays everywhere! Why would they make me sign that agreement then? The bathroom/shower was so tiny and the sink was outside. The beds could of been more comfortable. I expected more for being a suite. They consider it a suite because there is an extra wall and couch. They didn't even have soap in the room. I had to go down and ask for hand soap. And the CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST was horrible. They gave me two little pieces of paper and it said I can only choose from two options. The options were: Eggs, Pancakes, Muffin, and I forgot the other one. So I go downstairs expecting the Continental Breakfast buffet I've been to with other hotels, but this was not even close. It a small kitchen/Cafeteria and there was this line coming out the door. Only one lady making the breakfast. Besides her was a table with machines to disperse Orange Juice, Milk and Cereal.So waiting 15 minutes in a line that doesn't move I decided to just get some Orange Juice. I pushed the button, pure water came out. They were out of juice and no one came to refill it. So then I opted for cereal they had on that same table. The options were Fruit Loops and Total. They were out of Fruit Loops. I just decided to leave. It was horrible. We went out to a restaurant for breakfast instead and enjoyed our breakfast. Never again will I stay in a Days Inn. You want a nice hotel with comfortable beds. Nice decor, White sheets and white fluffy comforter, All you can eat continental breakfast. Stay at the Hampton Inn!!

Reviews.Title: “Hot Breakfast for Free”
Reviews.Author: Quiet_comfortable
Reviews.Content: From the outside it doesn't look like much and the lobby does not look like the photo? But the room was great. We had a balcony (not a great view) but the having the patio door open at night provided some great fresh air. We were also very impressed with the hot eggs and pancakes. This was much better than the standard danish, coffee, juice and mealy apples at most hotels. Beds were extremely comfortable. Would stay here again. Yes there are some seedy joints around the area, but did not see or hear any police cars or problems at night. Slept with the windows open and very quiet considering a light sleeper is writing this.

Reviews.Title: “Don't overpay for this motel”
Reviews.Author: zmanis
Reviews.Content: This place was old, the parking a joke (I'm just happy my car didn't get broken into overnight) and breakfast just barely edible. Other than that, you get what you pay for if you get a $75 a night rate like we did. We were there for 2 nights to see friends graduate from the Corps. One of our friends was charged $125 for the same room. They seem to up the rates near graduation time. The shuttle's are old and run down and only seat 9. Waits at the base and hotel were up to 1 hr.. The neighborhood's full of strip clubs and bars but close to the base. Time for a complete renovation! PS: Somebody may want to complain to San Diego PD about all the bums camping on the street and sidewalk between the hotel's buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: fluffybundles
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel quite nice. We were only there for a two night stay but the room was clean and bright and the air conditioning was great. You can hear people next door which didn't really worry us. Also, you can hear the planes occasionally. The free wireless internet in the room is nice. The breakfast is OK but nothing to write home about. The hotel isn't in the best area but it is centrally located and easy to get to anywhere you need to go. The staff isn't overly friendly but when there was a problem with the TV cable, they were quick to get notes out to all guests letting them know that the matter was being attended to. Next door is the Tio Carlos Mexican Restaurant. It is nothing much to look at from the outside but inside is lovely and the food is brilliant. Remember to bring your appetite. Also, make sure you have a map before you go anywhere. Sites like San Diego Zoo are not well marked.

Reviews.Title: “Location Great - Breakfast needs a healthier choice”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelsAlberta
Reviews.Content: Finding accomodation in San Diego was difficult for a family with two teenagers so when we chose the Days Inn Suites it was because of the two room layout. The rooms were a little tired but fairly clean....some unidentifiable stains on the bedsheets made the girl a little squeamish. The maintenance staff were friendly, the front desk - not so much. The biggest drawback to the arrangement was the breakfast provided. You were allowed two items from the hot breakfast selection ie: two pancakes or two muffins or one pancake and one muffin. There was cold cereal and some apples/oranges but, definitely no other healthy choices. No Yogurt, or other fruits available. Reminded me of the Dan Akroyd movie where the aliens ate "starch disks". Locationwise...we were close to anything that we wanted to get to. In summary, its no 10 but it's not a fail either.

Reviews.Title: “Less Than Average”
Reviews.Author: Demiking16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Days Inn for two nights as part of a Contiki Tour. I found the location to be out of the way since we had to take taxis to/from the Gaslamp district. The room was average, the cleaning service was practically nonexistent and the made-to- order breakfast was terrible. But the front desk attendants were very helpful and there is an excellent, excellent Japanese restaurant called Mine Sushi (3185 Midway Drive) in a small minmart within steps from the Days. Try the muchi dessert, it was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe and Scarey”
Reviews.Author: BarneyAB
Reviews.Content: Unsavory neighborhood,nudie bars etc... Unclean walkways. Food only soso. Felt unsafe in parking lot. Someone tried to enter our room around 7:00 A.M. Was not room service, the man tried to enter from the sliding glass patio door. A definate lack of security.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: jlpGa
Reviews.Content: I just recently returned from a 10 day trip to CA. We flew into San Diego and spent our first night at the Days Inn. I was looking for a reasonably priced suite because we have 4 kids. The room was very clean and the beds were very comfortable! It was also very spacious. I checked every Intenet site on every hotel in San Diego and feel like this hotel was a very reasonably priced room. The location was ok as well, although it may have been hard to find without our GPS. If you have a car, it is in a good location. The only complaint that I have is that the A/C did not work well in the room. It was cool enough that we just opened thte back door and it cooled off enough to sleep. This is not a 4 star hotel, but was very satisfactory for a place to lay your head!

Reviews.Title: “A dirty, cheaply run, over-priced hotel. Simply will not go back.”
Reviews.Author: bbqed
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel to be close to relatives we were visiting after attending a conference at the Convention Center. We traveled often and also overseas, never had such bad experience with management ( or the lack of management) as this one. We got back to our room late one evening, the room was not cleaned. Had to call front desk twice and after almost an hour the towels finally arrived at 11pm. Next morning, we asked to speak to the manager and was told that no manager is available on weekends and had to call or come back on Monday. We proceed to have their free breakfast. The breakfast area was like a zoo. Trash overflowing, food items ran out. It's apparent that the owner does not care about thier guests, hire as few staff as possible, demanding high prices for being close to Sea World, let the guests stuff as many people as possible in one 'suite'. The pictures on the web are deceiving. Noisy from early morning on, the ground is not maintained. We do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! The hotel pictures are decieving. A seedy & run down place.”
Reviews.Author: judgeeve
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean, peace & quiet place-- not worth the money for this barely maintained, run-down, poorly managed hotel. Breakfast is free but the overflowing garbage cans, water-down apple juice, the spill-over cereal on the counter poured back into the dispensing machine are all too gross. The ground is run down, trash everywhere. Guests packed the 'suites' with kids. Nothing against kids, but run around on the balcony by the pool at 7:30am. For that, I can stay at home and sleep in. The hotel try to squeeze in as many parking as possible making the one-car space driveway so narrow and dangerous to back out. When you try to complain and ask to speak to the manager, the front desk will tell you to come back on monday as there's no manager on duty on weekends. You be the judge. No manager on the 2 busiest days of the week at a 150+ room hotel. I didn't read the comments before booking this. Will never return to this dive.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn - Insomnia Guaranteed !!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gripper67
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic 3 week stay in California. Our last night was spent in Days Inn near to San Diego Airport. When booking the hotel we checked that there was a shuttle to the airport. We arrived late on Thursday night and asked the girl on reception could we book the 6.30 shuttle, she informed us that all of the shuttles were booked until 9.30, and that we would have to get 2 taxis to the airport. We wouldn't have booked this hotel had we been told this. It was now 11pm, we then went to bed, we eventually got to sleep at 3am, there was constant noise, people shouting, partying, arguing, doors getting slammed and heavily knocked on. It only stopped at 2.45am with the intervention of security and the threat of the Police. The next morning (3 hours later) I checked out of the hotel and complained to the guy on reception, he apologised and knocked $40 off my bill. I told him that their intervention should have been a lot earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Day's Inn”
Reviews.Author: Shannon092
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 11day trip to the Coast of California and our last stop was the Days Inn & Suites - Sea World/Airport. The hotel is great and the service was good. The staff was friendly and accomodating. The outside was getting some routine painting, which was nice to see. The rooms were spacious and VERY CLEAN!! Overall I would say this hotel was top notch, I am extremely fussy! They had a continental breakfast spread that could of had a little more of a variety, but it was included in the price, so heck it was good. The pool & hot tub were ok, however we did not use it, due to the overcast and breezy weather. We paid $60 per night for a room which we thought excellent value. And was close to everything..Mission Bay, La Jolla, the downtown, the waterfront...the San Diego Zoo.....everything within 5-10 minutes. It was great. The only downfall.....the airport is close (which is a plus for travel) but bad for the noise of the planes. A+ Across the board. I would stay again at this hotel if ever back in San Diego!

HotelInfo.Name: Days Inn & Suites - Sea World/Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 3350 Rosecrans Street, San Diego, CA 92110
